definitions.definition: To communicate with one's voice , to say words out loud .
examples: I was so surprised I couldn't speak .
It's been ages since we've spoken .

definitions.definition: To communicate or converse by some means other than orally , such as writing or facial expressions .
examples: He spoke of it in his diary.
Speak to me only with your eyes.

definitions.definition: To deliver a message to a group; to deliver a speech .
examples: This evening I shall speak on the topic of correct English usage.

definitions.definition: To be able to communicate in a language .

subdefinitions.definition: To be able to communicate in the manner of specialists in a field.

examples: I was so surprised that I couldn't speak a word.

definitions.definition: To communicate (some fact or feeling); to bespeak , to indicate .
To understand (as though it were a language).
examples: So you can program in C. But do you speak C++?

definitions.definition: To produce a sound; to sound .
Of a bird, to be able to vocally reproduce words or phrases from a human language.
To address ; to accost ; to speak to.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To communicate with one's voice , to say words out loud .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , reciprocal ) To have a conversation .
( by extension ) To communicate or converse by some means other than orally , such as writing or facial expressions .
( intransitive ) To deliver a message to a group; to deliver a speech .
( transitive , stative ) To be able to communicate in a language .
( transitive ) To communicate (some fact or feeling); to bespeak , to indicate .
( informal , transitive , sometimes humorous ) To understand (as though it were a language).
( intransitive ) To produce a sound; to sound .
Of a bird, to be able to vocally reproduce words or phrases from a human language.
( transitive , archaic ) To address ; to accost ; to speak to.
